transcripts.text: Hey everyone, welcome back to my channel.  In today's video, we're going to look at a crazy clip that recently aired on the Today Show wherein the Australian hosts take it upon themselves to dogpile a lovely mother of four children for basically caring too much about her family.

i want to take you back to the 1950s or at least that's what i thought when i read this brisbane mum's facebook post.  brooke smith shared her routine online.  here's what she said i always make sure i don't go to bed until everyone's lunches are packed their clothes are set out for the next day including my husband's and the house is clean.  dishwasher is on and a load of washing is on.  i always get up early 4 30 with my husband to make his breakfast and coffee.  um Go Brooke, whatever.

How is it being 1950s to simply want to care for your husband?  Most of the women I know do the exact same, including my mom.  Even after being married almost 35 years now, she's still awake at 5 a.m.  cooking breakfast for my dad and she even makes him a lunch as well to take to work.  My dad doesn't force her to do this, of course.  She does it out of the kindness of her heart because she loves him and because she's well aware that he has a very demanding job that would be made just a little bit easier if he didn't have to drive into town during his lunch break to get his own food.
I mean, I tell you what though, Chris, I mean, a lot of people online are saying, well done, are praising her.

Who?  Who are these people?  Who?  Who could these people possibly be?  Well, at least in the US, an article from 2018 states that more millennial women are choosing to be stay-at-home moms.  And as for the stats, the most recent Pew research seems to be from 2014, which shows that the number of women who are becoming stay-at-home moms has risen.  While 71% of moms do work outside the home, 29% are staying home.  That number is up 6% from 1999.  Also, I've got to say, I absolutely love how you have the token male feminist type thrown in there in order to assure the snobby woman that yes, yes, in fact, your opinion is completely right for every single woman on earth and any woman who might disagree with you belongs in the

1950s.  Oh, has he hypnotized her or something?  Who does this stuff?  Making his breakfast and then putting his clothes out of a night?  Is he disabled or something?  Like seriously, get a grip, get off your bum and do stuff yourself.

Okay, seriously, this guy is going above and beyond, totally overcompensating.  I'm sorry that his wife doesn't want to take care of him if he even has a wife, but it's no reason to insult and belittle the wives who do.  And no, wives don't cook for their husbands because their husbands are useless or can't do it for themselves, but because many of these men have extremely grueling jobs that actually require hard work, unlike this man's job where he basically just sits in a studio all day on a nice cushy sofa and criticizes people.
My only theory is that she might actually like her husband and she might actually like to get up at 4.30 and spend some time with him.
I mean, I like my husband, but make your own bloody breakfast and coffee.

I mean, you know.  And here it is, the admission.  Clearly the show host never cooks for her husband.  I honestly wouldn't be surprised if she never does any sort of household work at all.  And the reason it makes her so angry to see a woman who is able to do it all is because it makes her feel less about herself.  Naturally, the only way to ease this feeling of inadequacy is to attack the caring wife, to try to bring her down to her level.
Apparently this couple run an MMA fighting gym.  Mixed martial arts.  Mixed martial arts, and they also breed bulldogs, so they can do whatever they want.
You're not arguing.  Hey, you know what, if it makes her happy, but, I mean, nothing in that list of things there, you know.
And she's got four children under the age of six.

I guess it's finally occurred to the show host.  what an absolute jerk she's being.  Do what you want, she says.  It's a little bit too late for that.  You've already gone and exposed yourself as a jealous and insecure woman, which is once again confirmed in the next clip.  Somehow, the caring wife is able to co-run an MMA gym, breed bulldogs, raise four children, and take care of her husband all while maintaining her fitness and beauty.  On every front, she totally blows the show host out of the water.  Also, did you happen to catch that moment at the end where the man says, Women attacking women.  Terrible.
But did you see her photos too?  She still had time to, like, make her hair look beautiful and put her makeup on.
She looks gorgeous.  I think she looks gorgeous.

Um, sorry sir, but you participated in this attack just as much as your jealous co-host, so are you saying that women attacking women is totally unacceptable, but Men attacking women?  That's okay?  Look, it really doesn't affect me one way or the other.  whether or not a woman chooses to be a stay-at-home wife or mom.  That's up to them.  Some women might hate the lifestyle while others might be denied even the option due to the fact that their families can't be supported on one income.  Everyone has their own unique situations which can't always be properly judged by the outside world.  But to belittle and insult women who do choose to stay at home, or not even that, but who simply want to provide extra care to their husbands and children, is lower than low.  Once again, the feminist narrative of claiming to support all women is exposed as a pitiful lie.  The same types of competitive attitudes, the same types of jealousy and resentment that exists among many women are clearly more alive than ever.  Personally, I think the caring wife sounds like a wonderful person.  not to mention a solid model for what a lot of other women aspire to be.  She has a very lucky husband and children, and I sincerely hope that she doesn't for one second allow these jealous attacks on her to make her feel inferior.  Thank you so much for watching everyone.  I really hope you enjoyed.  Also, just as a quick note, the last several videos I've made, they've all been demonetized.  So if you would be kind enough to support my work, there are links to PayPal and Stripe in the description of this video.  Thank you once again for watching and I'll see you next time.
